p: Lactoferrin (LF) is a natural multifunctional protein belonging to the family of transferrin. It is present in the human milk and can be found in external secretions such as saliva, tears, milk, nasal and bronchial secretions, gastrointestinal fluids and urine mucosal secretions. LF is an important constituent of the neutrophilic granules of leukocytes ( Farnaud and Evans, 2003).
